intro: Psychotria antsirananensis, commonly known as the Madagascar Psychotria, is a species of flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments within the rainforests of Madagascar. Psychotria antsirananensis is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphological features and potential ecological significance in its native habitat.
